description: A Rx alarm has been reported on fibre on the local card.
This trap is sent only if the teFiberWrap value is set to enabled.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
TrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Local fiber RX port state: $v2; Slot: $v1

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached, wrapped, device incorrectly attached and data is looped back
within the port,or remoteFault the port is wrapped but the far end device
has been recognised on the receive fiber.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceFiberPortState

description: The user wrap state for a port has changed.
This trap is sent only if the teUserWrap value is set to enabled for that slot.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: User wrap state on port changed to $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the user port, values are active, device correctly attached
inactive, device incorrectly attached.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceUserPortState

description: The laser has reached its end of live.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Local laser reached its end of life

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The card has been removed from the Management Chassis.

event.Summary: Card removed from management chassis

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The user wrap state for a port has changed.
This trap is sent only if the teUserWrap value is set to enabled for that slot.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: User wrap state on port 2 changed to $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the second user port, if applicable. Values are active, device
correctly attached, inactive, device incorrectly attached.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceUserPort2State

description: A alarm has been reported on fibre A of the local card.
This trap is sent only if the teFiberWrap value is set to enabled.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
TrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Fiber A alarm on card in slot $v1. Port state is $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached, wrapped, device incorrectly attached and data is looped back
within the port,or remoteFault the port is wrapped but the far end device
has been recognised on the receive fiber.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceFiberPortState

description: A alarm has been reported on fibre B of the local card.
This trap is sent only if the teFiberWrap value is set to enabled.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
TrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Fiber B alarm on card in slot $v1. Port state is $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the secondary fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached, wrapped, device incorrectly attached and data is looped back
within the port,or remoteFault the port is wrapped but the far end device
has been recognised on the receive fiber.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceFiberPortBState

description: A alarm has been reported on fan of a module.
This trap is available for the 2.5Gbps card.

event.Summary: Local module fan state is $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: Status of the module fan.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::ifaceModuleFanStatus

description: The card has been inserted into the Management Chassis.

event.Summary: Card inserted into management chassis

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The user wrapstate for a port has changed.
This trap is sent only if the teUserWrap value is set to enabled for that slot.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: User wrap state on remote port changed to $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: The state of the remote user port. This is either active (carrying LAN
frequency data) or inactive, not carrying LAN frequency data.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceUserPortState

description: The PSU state has changed. This trap is sent only if the tePSUstate
value is set to enabled. This trap is sent to every management entity
specified in the TrapTable.

event.Summary: Remote PSU state changed to $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: This indicate the state of the PSUs in the remote chassis.
Possible messages are:
remotePSUsGood(1)
PSUs work normally;
remotePSUsGood(2)
Main PSU has failed;
remoteSecondaryPSUFailed(3)
Secondary PSU has failed;
remotePSUGoodButRedunantPSUnotFitted(4)
PSU good but no secondary PSU is fitted.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfacePSUStatus

description: The remote PSU status has changed. This trap is sent only if
the teTempenable is set in the TrapTable for that
slot.

event.Summary: Remote temperature status: $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: This indicate the state of the remote chassis.
Possible messages are:
remoteTemperatureNormal(1)
Temperature is acceptable;
remoteTemperatureHot(2)
The operating temperature within the chassis is too high;
remoteTemperatureCold(3)
The operating temperature within the chassis is too low.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceTempStatus

description: Fan fail reported on local card. This trap is sent to every
management entity specified in the TrapTable.

event.Summary: Remote fan failed on local card

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: Status of the remote fan.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceFanStatus

description: The laser has reached its end of live.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Remote laser reached its end of life

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: The local card has reported a fault with the remote card.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Remote fiber port state: $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number within the chassis.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::localSlotIndex

description: The state of the fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached or device not correctly attached at far end.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceFiberPortState

description: The user wrapstate for the second user port has changed.
This trap is sent only if the teUserWrap value is set to enabled for that slot.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
CLIGHTSystemTrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: User wrap state on second remote port changed to $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: The state of the remote second user port. This is either active
(carrying LAN frequency data) or inactive, not carrying LAN frequency data.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceUserPort2State

description: A alarm has been reported on fibre A of the remote card.
This trap is sent only if the teFiberWrap value is set to enabled.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
TrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Fiber A alarm on remote card. Port state is $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: The state of the fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached or device not correctly attached at far end.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceFiberPortState

description: A alarm has been reported on fibre B of the remote card.
This trap is sent only if the teFiberWrap value is set to enabled.
This trap is sent to every management entity specified in the
TrapTable for that slot.

event.Summary: Fiber B alarm on remote card. Port state is $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: The state of the secondary fiber port, values are inserted, device correctly
attached or device not correctly attached at far end.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceFiberPortBState

description: A alarm has been reported on fan of a module.
This trap is available for the 2.5Gbps card.

event.Summary: Remote module fan status: $v2

description: The index used to reference this element. This is effectively the
slot number in the chassis that this unit connects to.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteSlotIndex

description: Status of the module fan.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::remoteIfaceModuleFanStatus

description: The PSU state has changed. This trap is sent only if the tePSUstate
value is set to enabled. This trap is sent to every management entity
specified in the CLIGHTSystemTrapTable.

event.Summary: System PSU state: $v1

description: This indicate the state of the redundant PSU.
Possible messages are:
localPSUsGood(1)
PSUs work normally;
localPrimaryPSUFailed(2)
Main PSU has failed;
localSecondaryPSUFailed(3)
Secondary PSU has failed;
noLocalSecondaryPSUFitted(4)
No redundant PSU is fitted.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::cLIGHTSystemPSUState

description: The Temperature state has changed. This trap is sent only if the
tePSUstate value is set to enabled. This trap is sent to every
management entity specified in the CLIGHTSystemTrapTable.

event.Summary: System temperature state changed to $v1

description: This indicate the temperature of the management chassis.
Possible messages are:
localTemperatureNormal(1)
Temperature is acceptable;
localTemperatureHot(2)
The operating temperature within the chassis is too high;
localTemperatureCold(3)
The operating temperature within the chassis is too low.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::cLIGHTSystemTemperature

description: Fan fail reported. This trap is sent to every
management entity specified in the TrapTable.

event.Summary: System fan failed

description: This indicate the state of the FAN.
Possible messages are:
localFanOk(1)
Fans work normally;
localFanFailed(2)
Fan has failed.
variables.name: CityLight-MIB::cLIGHTSystemFanState
